I had the filet mignon and it was okay, and I wish I had ordered the duck. I can't really say why I only thought the filet mignon was only okay, but maybe it had to do with the fact that it was pretty salty too and I had just finished up a super salty gumbo? 

All in all, it was a fun experience because of the atmosphere and because all of the family was there. Would we have had just a good of a time had we gone somewhere else? Probably. But, this was birthday girl's choice and it was kinda fun to go to a celebrity chef's place and criticize their food. :)
Best filet of my life! I'll be back. Grits were a bit undercooked, but the steak and mushrooms made up for the oversight. Amazingly attentive and friendly waiters.

Is there an email address I can complain to about my experience somewhere? For being the priciest place we ate at during my trip to LV, this was definitely the most disappointing. Service was incredibly aloof. The food was sub-par. 

For 2 we ordered a few drinks, the Caesar salad and the Chateaubriand, both to share. The Caesar salad was delicious but how can you really go wrong with that? The main course was the absolute worst. Three pieces of meat per person, and it was barely lukewarm. I saw our server "heat" it up for maybe 3 seconds, and then take it off the grill. Although the meat was flavorful, the fact that it was almost COLD ruined the whole meal. Not only that, I asked our server to take a picture of us since it was my bday, and he handed over my camera to another server as if he was too good to take a damn picture!

At the end, we had a couple cups of coffee, and was given their birthday raspberry sorbet, which wasn't even edible. Overall NOT recommended.

I love Delmonico's, I really do.  But this past weekend, it just didn't measure up.  I should have gone with my gut and given CUT a try.  We started with drinks in the bar, which was fine.  Our table for seven was ready on time, which is always nice.  Unfortunately, our service was super average compared to what I've had in the past at Delmonico's and at other comparable high end steakhouses.  My husband and I shared a salad for an appetizer.  We let the server know this when we ordered and in the past, we've had this served on two separate plates in lieu of having to divide the salad at the table.  Unfortunately, we were given to salad plates and told we could split it ourselves.  

I love a good filet, and unfortunately, my filet was very average.  It was cooked to my liking, medium rare, but it was served relatively cool, which made me think that our food was sitting for a while before it was served.  My mom ordered seared ahi tuna which was served completely cold.  The outer edges were completely cooled after the searing, which again, tells me that our food sat out for a while.  My husband and my brother both ordered bone-in rib-eyes.  When the food was served, they brought one rib-eye that had been split in two.  The server went back to the kitchen and they realized they made a mistake and brought out the other rib-eye, while using tongs to take the half from my husband's plate and added it to my brother's plate.  Rookie move, seriously.

My family doesn't eat a ton of cards, so for sides we ordered two servings of the mushrooms, broccoli, and corn for my niece.  The server kept pushing for us to order a starch, which we insisted we didn't want- very bizarre, it's not like we weren't running up a pretty hefty tab.

It was my mom's birthday and I really thought Delmonico's would come through with an excellent experience.  The food was okay overall, but I really can't say that this meal met my expectations or anyone at our tables' expectations.  I've been to many Emeril restaurants, maybe they went through a recent management change??  I don't know, I wish I could explain the extremely average experience.

Every single thing that we have tried here was above expectations. Had the filet mignon and Colorado rack of lamb with roasted fingerling potatoes and garlic mushrooms. The filet was oh so soft and the lamb was ever so juicy! Will come back here for yet another dinner splurge.

Dinner was fabulous. The bone in ribeye was perfectly done, the filet was blue as requested, not an easily done prep-and spit on. The grits, as well as the creamed spinach very tasty. The banana cream pie a perfectly yummy dessert for two. Well worth the price.

What better place to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday and Yelp Spring Break than in Las Vegas! I wanted to surprise my bf so I made reservations through open table for dinner at Delmonico. When we arrived the hostess wished my bf a happy birthday and we were told to have a seat in the waiting room. Wow that waiting room was super nice but also packed! Lucky for us as we turned around to scan for a seat the hostess called my name and said our table was ready.

Upon being seated we were greeted by our server. He also wished my bf happy birthday and took our drink orders. When the waiter returned with our water he also brought some warm, soft, honey rolls the melted in our mouths. We decided to start with the Petite Iceberg Lettuce Wedge salad followed by a Twice Baked Potato ($9) and Rib-eye ($48) for me and Short Rib Special ($35) for my bf. Before our salads came out the waiter brought a small appetizer for us to share- compliments of the chef. I don't remember what exactly it was but it was so delicious!

The wedge salad ($13) was composed with petite iceberg lettuce wedges and topped with apple smoked bacon and red onion with buttermilk blue cheese dressing. There was A LOT of crumbled blue cheese on the salad- almost a little too much for me. It was enough for both of us to share and enjoy before we got our steak knifes and forks ready for what was to come next.

I wish I were hungrier at the time- my rib-eye was HUGE! After the rolls and salad my steak and bf's short rib looked almost impossible to finish and it was quite a challenge. The rib eye was thick, juicy and tender- served with a slice of melting butter on top. Every bite felt so sinful as it tasted so good despite how full I was I couldn't stop indulging in more. I tried my best to eat my half of the twice baked potato. It was really smooth and rich with bacon and Vermont cheddar.

I can't say much about my bf's short rib since I was too busy trying to finish my ribeye. I know he really enjoyed it and the meat was so tender it fell apart with a light brush from his fork.

After dinner the server brought my boyfriend a complementary scoop of banana sorbet for his birthday. He likes bananas but usually doesn't like banana flavored foods. The sorbet was so fresh and smooth he actually really enjoyed it and finished! With a food coma coming on and $115 later we postponed surprise #2 (dessert at Serendipity) and cabbed back to our hotel and called it a night. Who does that in Vegas!?!? 

P.S. I can't wait back to try the Creekstone Farms Naturally Raised Angus, Carved Tableside for Two with Asparagus and Garlic Smashed Potatoes. Time to start saving up again...

As part of a birthday celebration weekend for two of my cousins, a group of us decided to head to Delmonico Steakhouse for a really nice birthday dinner. We had no idea what to expect of this place, except for the high prices. 

We were running late for our reservation, but we called the restaurant letting them know we were on our way. It was a group of 6, so we really did not want to loose our reservation. They could not have been any more helpful over the phone! Directions were provided, and they kindly held our table until we arrived.

Upon arrival, we were quickly escorted to our table. Our server kindly welcomed us and wished my two cousins a very happy birthday and memorable meal. After we all ordered our entrees, we were pleasantly surprised with complimentary appetizers for the entire group (halibut ceviche which was to die for!!). Their bread rolls were extremely delicious and always kept coming. Water was always replenished without even asking. Always a step ahead those people! When it came time to receiving our entrees, the wait staff made sure that all our orders were correct before setting them on the table. The dinner was then completed with complimentary sorbet (made in house). Everything was delicious!!! No one had any complaints about anything.

The service was excellent; above and beyond my expectations of any restaurant. I have been to other restaurants like Delmonico's at The Venetian for birthday celebrations, and none match the superb service and attention of Delmonico. Despite the fact that the restaurant's prices are high, the overall experience, taste of the food, and service make it an exceptional place for any occasion.

Long overdue review! Went back in July...and swore to myself I needed to give the place kudos because we had such a lovely experience. The food was delicious...and yes, it's a steakhouse, but I'd go back just for the banana cream pie. Oh...how I long for that pie. Anyway...the standout though has got to be the service. When our steaks came, I was disappointed to see that my steak had been overcooked - but it was clearly a busy night (and it looked like they had some crazy difficult customers that night), and I'm not usually one to complain, so I figured it still tasted good, and said nothing. But the manager, Ken, was nearby, and must've seen me sort of picking and inspecting my food, and he came by to make sure things were okay. I said they were fine, but he insisted on checking it out for me -- and in the end, even though I had already taken a few bites, he brought me a whole new steak and made sure it was cooked the way I liked before he left us to dine. That is fantastic service. \n\nFood was delicious, foie gras was heavenly (damn you California for banning it!), and the service top notch.

Amazing. From the service to the food. 
We had reservations for 6 pm. And were seated almost as soon as we walked in. Everyone was friendly and our waiter was very knowledgeable with the menu. The bread and that butter with honey is amazing. 

I ordered steak, potatoes and broccoli and my bf ordered the ribs. 
We both really enjoyed our food. Even the salad was amazing. 
We will definitely we back when we R in town. 
Bookmarked for the future (: I highly recommend this restaurant

We had to come back here again on our most recent visit to Vegas. It was as good as we remember it. The lobster bisque, filet, and chocolate soufflé did not disappoint. The only minor complaint I have this time is with the cocktails. Too much ice and no garnish. For the type of restaurant it is, it should also not be using regular ice cubes from an ice machine. The drinks should not only taste good, but look delicious as well. \nI would not hesitate to come back here.

We ordered the Chateau Brian and it was awesome!  The steak cheese fondue is to die for.  Quality of beef was very good.  Service is good beside the fact that there is a huge party in front of us.  LOL.  One of the best steakhouse in Vegas I would say.  Will come back during slower, non-trade show time to experience better service.

Out of all the fabulous restaurants this hold one of the top rank on my mind.  That's a lot to be said.

Next time we're in Vegas we'll be sure make a stop here.  Make your reservation because this place is pack!

Screaming toddlers ruined it. 

We have been coming here for a couple of years but tonight I couldn't believe that 1) they actually had high chairs and 2) people would be so inconsiderate to bring toddlers to this restaurant. 

The food and service was impeccable as always but if you're paying $200+ for a meal you don't want kids banging silverware and having tantrums. 

While we love it here we will consider coming much later or somewhere else completely for a nice quiet adult dinner. 

Dear parents, don't bring your kids here. Don't bring your kids to a casino. Disneyland is 3 hours a way. Go there instead.

Fantastic food, great service.  Much more expensive than what we usually spend on dinner, but so yummy and worth it!  We both had steak for dinner, with sides of salad in the sherry ving., garlic smashed potatoes, and the pecan pie.  I wish we had room to finish the pecan pie, but could only get through half.

In Vegas a few nights seeking a great steak dinner. The petit filet mignon was yummy! Also a great individual portion, anything else simply too large. Dinner rolls the best !! Also the truffle pasta appetizer is a must try! Waiters provided good service too.
Food was amazing!! Portions were big (especially steak).  One of the better steakhouses in Vegas.  A bit pricey but at least the food is delicious!

The BEST steakhouse ever. The perfect amount of seasoning/flavor and a nice huge cut of perfectly cooked bone-in ribeye earns this establishment a 5 from me. every time I eat at a different steakhouse I always compare it to Delmonico's. Some other steakhouses in LV might hold a higher rating from "professional reviewers", but seriously, they don't hold a candle to this joint.

The decor is plain but that's not why you come here. You go to Delmonico for the great steaks, sides and yummy desserts. This place is almost always five stars for me but this last visit I made then mistake and deviated from my normal order of filet mignon and did the surf and turf special instead. The lobster was good (not sure if I would say amazing since it was slathered in bearnaise sauce) but the steak was only so-so; not up to normal Delmonico quality. Covering it in the amazing house steak sauce did help but I wouldn't recommend ordering the surf and turf.

I have been coming to this place for the last five years and it never disappoints.  One of my Vegas go to dining spots.  Visited last Thursday again.  A few favorites:

Arrive early and visit Max the Bartender.  Just recently learned he is a world class mixologist (after ordering wine for years) and will create beverages that will make your head spin.  Has his own bitters collection to add a custom touch.  Tequila Gumption he made me was world class.

I always get the Filet Pittsburgh Style and it is exceptional.  Not too loaded down with butter and just the right flavor.  If I am steaked out, The Salmon dish is incredible.  Creamed Corn is to die for with jalapeno seasoning topping (I am hyper critical of creamed corn but thing D's and STK are two of the best).  Biscuits that they serve are out of this world.  Potato chips with truffle oil are a nice indulgence.  Caprese salad is a great starter.  Like the wine list and not over priced like Del Frisco and the Wynn or Bellagio spots.

Finish it off with a double espresso and you are ready to venture on into the evening.

I prefer to sit in the main room and the seating towards the back is preferred.  Lamont is the best server by far.

The best service I had was here during my time in Las Vegas. The al a cart sides were large enough to share family style. My filet was overcooked and the server had another one out to me in minutes. The martinis were wonderful in chilled glasses with blue cheese olives. The table settings beautiful.

Best meal EVER! (also the most expensive...but worth it).\n\nThe food was just unbelieveable. We had a special gnocchi/lump crab appetizer, wedge salad, filet & ribeye, roasted potatoes w/garlic, and pecan pie for dessert. Food coma! Everything was absolutely perfect and the service was excellent. Highly recommended for a special occasion.

Last night I had the salmon with a side of grits followed up by that he banana cream pie. It is amazing how good food can be! Just loved it. The food is pricey but if you want to give yourself a treat then this is the place to go.

I came for a restaurant week lunch with my two lovelies, Sandra and David and my husband joined before he headed to work. This 3 course was $30.15.

The 3 of us not working that day ordered beverages. This place made my heart sing because they had a Whisky BOOK. To be handed pages upon pages to browse on top of the other spirits, wine menu AND cocktail menus made my damn head spin because I wanted a lot of things. I settled on getting the Scarlet Starlet which had Glenmorangie 10, Tuaca, lime, hibiscus, strawberry and egg whites. It was totally up my alley - very much the scotch shined then the balance of the rest of the ingredients came through. Very much worth the $16 in alcohol and skill in mixing- the bartender Michelle was great.

Appetizer I got VINE-RIPENED HEIRLOOM TOMATO SALAD (With Burrata Cheese, Red onion, Balsamic Vinegar and Torn Local Basil) which was standard, but good because the components were quality and fresh. 

Entree I got PAN ROASTED ATLANTIC SALMON( With Sweet Corn & Crab Vinaigrette and Fresh Basil) which was nicely cooked and was very fresh and clean. I liked the large pieces of lump crab mixed in with the corn. 

Dessert the hubby and I shared:

BANANA CREAM PIE PARFAIT(Caramel Sauce, Chocolate Shavings, Whipped Cream and Graham Crumbs) was a solid dessert that could convince someone who doesnt like banana cream. The custard in it was creamy while still being light. 

TRADITIONAL BREAD PUDDING(With Warm Caramel Pecan Sauce) I love bread pudding and this was good, but average. I do appreciate that the caramel was flavorful while not being saccharine sweet.

I thought it was a solid lunch, but I am coming back for drinks as there's very few places on the strip I've enjoyed the beverage offerings as this. Fantastic beverage program for the libation lover.

Five Star food and Five Star service! Fantastic beef and you have to try the banana pie!\nI know that every restaurant has a bad day, but some of the bad reviews I read are completely ridiculous. My guess is that either too much alcohol was consumed by people complaining and/or these reviews come from people that think food trucks are fine dining.\nPrices are very reasonable for the great food and service. This is a must try when visiting Vegas.

Minimalist decor, maximalist flavor!  the dry-aged ribeye steak was a marvel of cut and cure, and flawlessly prepared with a lump of butter oozing over the edges (as if the marbled steak didn't have enough cholesterol to make me reach for a double hit of pravastatin!) I generally order beef cooked medium-well which tends to dry out the meat; however the chefs here knew what they were doing and delivered the most fork tender medium well i have ever eaten!  The maitre'd oversaw the dining sequence and operation with panache, though the grim-faced waiters could have used a few lessons on how to develop an engaging personality.  The prices were reasonable for Vegas top flight restaurants.

Great food, great staff.  Came for a steak, a steak is what I got.  Sides were amazing but not needed especially after my soup.  Never had to ask for water, never had to fill up my own wine glass.  Staff was excellent.  Knew before hand about dietary needs and overcame them.  I would defiantly recommend if you coming or stating near the palazzo.

f you are going to eat here the only suggestion as mentioned before is to go with the Porterhouse. You will not regret it! At $85 the price is a bit of a turn off and there are other nice cuts available around a $50 range. Although, at 32 oz and being one of the best steaks I ever had in my life it was well worth it. Service was also fairly good although not superb. Very professional staff but during the busy dinner hours are not the most attentive.\n\nI made my reservations well in advance on the Venetian website and did not have to wait a minute to be seated.

I had better expectations for this place based on the reviews.  I ordered the bone in ribeye, which was touted as their "signature dish".  The meat was not well marbled and was quite gristly for the price.  The quality of meat was comparable to an Outback or Black Angus.

Such a disappointment!  Here in Vegas with family, we're all a bit of foodies and selected Delmonicos for its reputation as a great steakhouse.  We've dined at other Emeril restaurants and been very pleased, including another Delmonicos location.  The ambiance of the restaurant was considerably lacking.  You expect a steakhouse to have that rich dark woods atmosphere.  This was very bland and nondescript in a city that does things to an excess..  The steak, a bone in ribeye was good but not OMG.  Barbecue shrimp appetizer and popovers were delicious.  Side dishes including the Au gratin potatoes were fair.  Banana cream pie is a must have.  The freezing cold restaurant added to the disappointment.

Came back here with in a month just to show my wife the deliciousniss of the lobster bisque...it was just as good the 2nd time...too bad during lunch..they don't give the lobster as  a garnish as they do during dinner.  \n\nLunch service was ok...you can tell the difference from the dinner service.  But the food was good still.  I did want to try the lobster sliders....some one else go that and it looked pretty good...you get 2 sliders.  I had the pasta dish during lunch but the flavors was a bit bland and the dish was forgetable.

Service was great but being a steakhouse, I would have expected a lot better steaks! Table ordered 1 filet, 3 ribeyes and a New York - meat lacked seasoning, dry and 3 of the 5 were overcooked! Side dishes were okay. Best thing was the wedge salad! Definitely not a place I would return!

Best pecan pie ever!\nShrimp cocktail, good but nothing special, I thought it would be more Cajun. Oysters fresh and the horseradish was so good! Lobster bisque very good. The steak was pretty good I had a filet mignon and my husband had the Ribeye it was huge! Everything was cooked well. I have had a better steak but it was good. The best thing was the dessert of pecan pie. I'm just going to go there for that!

I usually only Yelp a location when I either have something negative to say (sad but true) or when I think I'm being witty. lol 

Today, for what I think is the first time, I'm Yelping because I'm just so incredibly impressed. EVERYTHING was delicious. Amazing. My husband got the bone in rib eye and I got the filet mignon.... so good. Sides were twice baked potato (better than my mom's, sorry mom) and cream corn. Literally some of the best food I've ever had. Great service too. 

Expensive, yes. But very well worth it. :)

In my opinion it's not fit for a foodie. Meal was very good but not superb. However, service was great. I wasn't impressed by their BBQ shrimp which was highly recommended as their signature appetizer.  Fish was cooked perfectly but most of the food only had 2 dimensions.  I expected more complexity and excitement in their flavors. Overall great for a cocktail and a good meal but Las Vegas has so many places in this category. I would love a large well known restaurant on the strip to go above and beyond. 

If you aren't adventurous and just want a good meal with all your great basics on the menu this is perfect. It's a crowd pleaser but definitely lacking in excitement. 

If I were to rate the food it would only be 3 stars but the service is very good so I gave them 4 stars. I will be back for drinks but it wouldn't be my first choice for food.

I blame my father for my inordinate love of all things gourmet. Thankfully, I appreciate a good burrito as much as I appreciate a good steak, but I will definitely seize every opportunity to dine in style as much as I can.

Thanks to a family trip to Vegas, I got to eat at Emeril's, once more partaking our family's favorite pasttime: eating. We had eaten at the original location in New Orleans when I lived there, and it was one of my top 5 dining experiences of all time. This one definitely tied that experience.

As other people have said, if you're not going to eat steak in some form when you come here, you're wasting your time. The steak is truly a peak experience for meat lovers. We all ate our  steaks in silence, save for the "OMG!" and "MMMM!" and "wow.wow.wow."  They all had the filet mignon, and I had the bone-in dry aged ribeye: the best steak I have ever eaten in my life. It came on a bed of perfectly creamy garlic mashed potatoes and foie gras butter just melting into it. 

Have you ever had lightly tempura battered asparagus? It's worth coming here just to try them. 

Even the sides- delicious spinach he made without cream that was STILL good (shocking, I know), and broccoli cooked to perfection...we all kept remarking how absolutely everything was just perfect.

The other thing that distinguishes restaurants like this is the service.  Places like this are in a whole other league- waiters who seem to read your mind, appearing and disappearing before you even realized you needed something - never interrupting conversation, never hovering, always classy and helpful. Our waiter chose the perfect wine for us with with the vague descriptions of what we were looking for, and it truly was the best complement to our meals ever. 

The design of the room is also a refreshing breath of fresh air from all the gaudy glitz and obnoxious 'bigness' of Vegas; simple, clean lines and understated elegance and chairs that make it seem like your table is totally self-contained and isolated from the other tables. Great to have that feeling of privacy.

We lingered for hours just basking in the glow of such perfection and decadence.

He may be a TV celebrity chef, but you can't take away credit where credit is due: Emeril is a fantastic restaurateur.  My wife and I have dined here twice; the first time because we were staying at the Venetian and the second time we purposely came back to eat here on one of our anniversaries while staying in Vegas.  In short this is a fantastic formal steakhouse experience all around.  What sold us was the Chateaubriand for two. Expertly cooked and finished off by table side with a flame of cognac for that over-the-top Vegas style experience.  Quite possibly one of the most memorable steaks we've had in our life. Tender with an explosion of flavor when you take a bite, mmm.  There are several wonderful side dishes you can choose to complement the meat and so far we haven't been disappointed in any of them whether you go for the vegetable of the day (garlic pan fried green beans the last time were there) or the bacon and cheddar grits, mashed potatoes, or baked potato. Oh and for your prerequisite greenery before the meat course they also do a fantastic Caesar salad prepared at table side for 2 as well.  Desert? Yes please!  You can't go wrong with their caramel cream brulee but everything on their dessert menu looked sweetly decadent.  I don't think I need bother describing the wine or drink menu here other than this is Vegas after all and if you possibly couldn't find what you're after here to complement your meal then I'm sure they could get it for you.
Went here for guys weekend. Unbelievable. Ravioli app was so good. The steak was very good too. When getting a good bottle of wine, make sure they decant it for you...had to ask.

This is one of the most amazing restaurant I've ever had. I made a reservation for Fourth of July for my boyfriend's birthday. The service was 5 stars, my water was never below one sip level. We had three servers for our table. I've been waiting for their bone in ribeye as review said it was good. It was better than I expected. We had two appetizers beef cappacio and table side  Caesar salad, halibut, delicious! And caramel cake dessert was perfect. The servers had also given us a birthday banana walnut ice cream. Highly recommend this place!

Meh. Just .. meh. For the price we paid, I expected better food, and better service.

Although my steak was cooked properly, my husband's steak was not. The service was slow and not especially friendly.

Honestly, save your money - you can get better steak, better service, and better drinks at Ruth's Chris.

One of the top steak places I've had in Vegas aside from STK and CraftSteak! 

My friends and I started off with the steak tartare and truffle chips which were on point! It was shareable between the four of us and held us over until our steaks! They gave us complimentary bread that was so warm and slightly crispy....it was heavenly! 

I ordered the NYS, medium well and it came out perfectly cooked with garlic butter on top. The steak was huge and I was able to eat 3/4!! Honestly, all top steak places in Vegas taste the same to me due to the high quality meats they use but what I look for in these restaurants are the quality and taste in the sides and appetizers! 

The sautéed mushrooms were seasoned perfectly and very tasty. The smashed potatoes were creamy and complimented the steaks very well! 
The service was excellent; I highly recommend this place!

My wife & I dined here while we were in Vegas for a conference. With so many places to choose from we decided on Delmonico because it was in our hotel & we figured we couldn't go wrong at one of Emeril's restaurants. The dining area was very spacious & well decorated. The staff was very friendly and attentive to all our needs. I started with the wedge salad which was excellent. The bacon had a great smokey flavor & was crispy. The blue cheese was some of the best I ever had. My wife had the lobster bisque which was excellent as well. We the decided to try the Chateaubriand dinner for 2 which came with garlic mashed potatoes & asparagus. The meal is brought out and the meat is served table side. We ordered it medium rare & it was perfect for me. It had excellent flavor and was extremely tender. My wife would have preferred it to be a little more cooked in the center but she ate the outer pieces which for a little more well down but still tender & tasty. The potatoes & asparagus were both  perfectly cooked with great flavor. We passed on dessert because we were too full to eat anything else. I would highly recommend this restaurant & would eat there again when in Vegas!

We stayed at the venetian and as a very special treat had reservations for the hubby's birthday.  

We received warm friendly smiles as soon as we arrived and were quickly at our table for 4.  

I ordered a Filet Mignon medium rare with country smashed potatoes.

we also had the best prepared Caesar salad ever to encounter my taste buds made table side.  

The steak just literally melted in my mouth.  I was in utter awe and in an orgasmic state.  With each tantalizing bite I felt I was being lifted into food heaven.  This was hands down the best Filet Mignon I have had thus far!

Our Server was kind funny and on point.  The wine selection is impressive and we had our two bottles to the last drop:)  Hey we were celebrating remember(hubby's bday)

I satisfyingly finished my meal off with a homemade sorbet
This will be a memorable moment locked away in my taste buds memory!

Our foodie friend Chung recommended us to this wonderful place. 

This place is dark, it felt like eating in a rustic wine cellar. 
The waiters are friendly.
I ordered Bone in New York strip and Mr.Q ordered himself  Bone in rib eye.
The presentation of the steak looks poor, when I saw the giant portion of sizzling steak was drowning in the oil and come out in a hot plate.  I told myself " that couldn't be good". It made me changed my mind immediately after I took my first bite. It was juicy, meaty, tasty, tender and much much more. Wow! Amazingly tasty! The quality of the steak is really good. 
The steak is d*mn good, but huge. I left half of it. What a waste of such beautiful piece, I wish I could bear a spandex tummy instead of wear spandex dress.

Thank you Chung for the wonderful recommendation and a wonderful happy tummy evening for me and Mr.Q.

Had solo lunch at a table. The service here is some of the best I've ever encountered, hands down. Lunch may be a little more casual than dinner but there was no evidence of it in the level of professionalism. As time permitted, the staff really appreciated chatting about food and restaurants.

I enjoyed the rich, super savory lobster bisque immensely. A meal in itself. The cajun salmon - featuring a nice salmon filet, french fried onions, and andouille hash - was prettty delicious. The best thing in this dish was the perfectly-cooked and seasoned salmon. While important to the overall combination, the cajun sauce was a little too gelatinous and as a result its sweetness was more cloying in my opinion. I thought had it been thinner it would have blended in more without overpowering with its texture. Overall the dish was very tasty.

Delmonico's is extremely formal and professional but still has the makings of a fun place. I'd have to try their steaks to be able to really give it five stars.Reviewing other food in a steak place isn't completely fair.
Amazing.... wine is great from a wide range, great side dishes, and on-point steak/lobster! I had the steak and my wife had the lobster

Steak Lover's motto: A steak cooked beyond medium rare is fit only for dogs.

Like many a Vegas Steakhouse, I feel like the excitement and constant crowds provide easy business to this high-end restaurant and that easy patronage has caused them to rest a little on their laurels. 

The service I received was adequate but not commensurate with the price level of this restaurant. The side dishes were very good. The steak was also very good, but at this price, it should have been exceptional. 

The ribeye was very tasty. It obviously came from a happy, well-fed and fatty bovine donor. The unusual cajun seasoned rub was also a unique and complimentary twist. It was cooked to the requested temperature (rare), and it tasted great. My beef with their beef is simple: it could have been served with a hotter searing, on a hotter plate, and in a larger portion size. For the price, I expect a larger steak than this, and for that reason, I would probably go to Mastro's next time. 

The meal was good enough that I would still go here again for another try if I get dragged along by other friends. We'll see how that goes. Till then, bon appetit!

-The Beef Baron
Amazing food, amazing service...loved the yorkshire pudding instead of bread!  Definitely, would recommend this location to anyone in Vegas!
A Las Vegas classic, great steaks, a nice rendition of the Manhattan original.

I've been to this restaurant 3 times in the last 4 years.  The first time was amazing.  The bbq shrimp appetizer had big delicious shrimp, the steak was super tender and cooked just right and the service was impeccable, servers are there just when you want them and not more.  Also, the sommelier made an excellent wine suggestion that was reasonably priced.

My friends and I liked the place so much after the first time that we kept talking about going back the next time we were in Vegas.  The place was crowned as the place to go for our annual Vegas outing.  

Unfortunately, the next two times I came back were utter disappointment.  The second time, I took my then fiancee.  We ordered the French onion soup, the BBQ shrimp and I had a rib-eye.  I forget what she had as an entree.  The French onion soup was gross, it tasted like dish water.  So we asked the waiter to bring us the Lobster Bisque instead.  It took us too long to find our server though.  To their credit, they took the french onion off of our tab.  The lobster Bisque was not special, very bland even for lobster bisque.  The shrimp came out very poor, the bbq sauce tasted burnt and the shrimp were small.  And to top the night off, my steak was medium well almost well done, when I had asked for medium rare.

The third time, I went with my friends.  The wine suggestion was poor and it was tres expensive.  Also, the food was just as mediocre as the second time I went.

I give the place two stars despite the food being ok, because of the price.  Also, I think the service has gotten weaker since my first visit.  Hopefully, this place can get back into fighting form, but I won't know because I doubt I'll be coming back.

I have been a big fan of emeril so I was excited to go... But I really wouldn't go back unless it was free. The best thing there was the service. The team that waits on your table is awesome. But for the food... The foie gras was good... The Caesar salad was okay, too much dressing but good flavor, the creamed corn tasted good but had too much breeding, the grits are not  grits... More like risotto. My husbands ribeye was only okay and for the price it should have been better. The macnut bread pudding and the banana cram pie... Stay away they are NOT good. And I think the most disappointing thing was the gumbo... It tasted like crap. I have been to the south and expected better gumbo from him.
The steak was delicious and the sides amazing defiantly worth the price and defiantly enjoyed my meal and experience. Service was excellent defiantly recommend.

I had a late-ish dinner around 9 here on Friday the 28th of July after seeing Phantom at the Venetian because the restaurant was close to the theater. I noticed there was a piano in the waiting room but no one was playing it; instead they were blasting the sportscast on the TV which soured the mood. Once seated the atmosphere was largely pleasant but also a bit too loud and some of the staff seemed uncertain and nervous. Our head server in particular was not enjoying himself at all and was visibly annoyed by the group across from our table which was loitering around the restaurant for a long time after finishing their meal. \n\nThe meal itself was very good, especially my Bone-in-Ribeye which is their signature cut. It's a slightly glazed and massive piece of meat, rubbed with a Cajun sauce that gave it zest and even a bit of spice. It paired beautifully with the Bourbon-Bacon Manhattan I ordered at the bar. My dining companion had the New York strip which was fine but not nearly as memorable as the Bone-in. Like the cuts of the meat, the sides are probably too big and one side is more than enough for 2 people. However both of the sides we had (The Wild Mushrooms and the Spinach) were delicious so it would be difficult to pick one. The appetizers were relatively standard, with the exception of the Parmesan-Truffle Chips but be forewarned that delicious as they are they are very filling and quite greasy.

Came here to eat dinner and everything for the most part was delicious. I got the bonein ribeye cooked medium rare. It was perfectly cooked and I was satisfied. It's pretty big but I still finished mines cause it was bomb. Ordered a bunch of sides too which were good. Nothing too special about them. However don't order the chicken my sister doesn't really eat red meat so she ordered it and it was dry. We ordered two desserts the banana cream pie and the butter cake. Both were good but the banana cream pie was exceptional! All in all it was a good experience and the food was worth the price

I am a foodie.  I have watched many a show from Lagrasse.  I had expectations that were not made.  Service was great, ambience was good.  I had the petite lettuce wedge... ok.  I had the BBQ Salmon.  Was not impressed.  It was cooked to the stated level, cut of fish was good but the BBQ was not good and the sausage potatoe hash was lacking.  For the price of the dinner , it was not worth it.
Outstanding lobster bisque and gumbo. Got a bit loud at times with large groups, but we enjoyed a delicious ribeye and filet. Both are good choices.

It's been at least a year and half since i hit delmonico's - i wanted to try CUT but the person that invited me and was flipping the bill, chose the bam guy's steakhouse and since i was free loadin' - all good with me.

ate around 6 - started with a fat tire ale, then a sauvignon blanc - both hit the spot after the heated drive. ordered the bone-in rib eye with blue cheese melted on top - medium ( i believe it costs $52 - i didn't have my reading glasses - difficult to read ! ) twice baked potato,( $9) asparagus ($8)  and the gumbo of the day ( $10)

amuse buche - some sort of mushroom tapanade on a crostini - not bad !

the gumbo - ok - kinda dull - expected more heat 

the steak - shear perfection - and with the blue cheese bubblin' and slightly browned -  B -  U -  T  - fulllllll

the sides - all decent 

the group shared banana cream pie and banana bread pudding - GREAT !

we had 2 bottles of pinot noir - sonoma - could not read the name but it worked with the steak.

a meal like this is almost pushing me back into the rat race so i can enjoy the wining/dining i left behind when i retired.

I cannot believe this place is rated anything less than 5 full stars.

I have eaten steak dinners that cost twice as much, yet they cannot touch the bone-in ribeye at Delmonico's.  NYC steakhouses are shamed by this Vegas institution.

Service has always been impeccable.  The sides and apps are great (I like the steak tartar), but the bone-in ribeye is the king of all steaks.

I've been to Vegas twice and to Delmonico's twice.  It's the only place I insist friends visit when they go to Vegas.  It's better than craps or blackjack!

WOW. This place did not disappoint. I had a pretty high expectation, especially after seeing 5 reviews (yeah out of 600+ lol) that said the steak might be better than Mastro's my most favorite steakhouse. 

Being a true tubby at heart, I was the only one who ordered 2 appetizers lol. I had the BBQ shrimp (it's aight), wilted spinach & frisée (super delicious), and I tried the ravioli too (my friends loved it but it's aight for me maybe because I wasn't feeling like pasta). 

I had the Chateaubriand for my main and I lovvvveee the Creole seasoning on it. It was served with a huge handful of asparagus that looked really fresh and mash, which tasted delicious with the creole juice/sauce. My medium-rare steak was cooked perfectly and was super delish. Mastro's steak still wins though!

We also had a side of grits (good) and creamed corn (yummy). And for dessert, as usual we had a buffet of it. The best ones (in order): Bourbon bread pudding, pecan pie, espresso Creme brûlée. The chocolate cheesecake just wasn't my thing. My hubby also had their Blue Mountain coffee and he seemed to like it. 

I'm happy this is a chain (lol) because Delmonico is going to my regular/Yum Yum list!!

I wanted to get a nice steak while in Vegas.  There were several options in Venetian/Palazzo alone.  I picked this one because, well, bam!  No but I figured a guy like Emeril Lagasse would make sure his steakhouse served a nice steak.

The decor inside is nice and clean, not a whole lot going on.  The opposite of a Red Robin, say.  Service was duly attentive.  Caesar salad prepared table-side was a treat.  

We went with cocktails over wine from the rather pricey and extensive wine list.  I didn't even eyeball the list personally.  But a generous portion of Bombay Sapphire satisfied nicely.  

I went with a bone-in New York, medium-rare.  It was cooked expertly.  It had great texture and flavor, a nice creole seasoning rub on there but not too heavily applied.  The beef did the talking.  Or the mooing.  It was good.  Only ordered one side on account of a late lunch and we're not rich: mushrooms sauteed in butter.  I feared some pain old sauteed buttons would come out.  But I was rewarded.  A hearty mix of flavorful 'shrooms, like oyster and chantrelle and maybe porcini or shiitake came out.  Lovely.  And buttery.  and Garlicky.

How can you screw up on Boned in New York twice? Come to Delmonico's.  Medium means Well Done.  No pink what so ever.  And they even cooked two steaks. 

Is your steak fine? After all your friends have eaten? Yes.  It's fine because I don't want to wait around for you to screw up anymore.  

Only saving grace was the bourbon.  

Basically, screwed up on steak.  Luke warm coffee.  Oh hell, might be a bad night, but my five other friends had good dinners.  Didn't want to bitch and spoil their evening.

We expected much better. The design of this restaurant is great, the service is great but the steaks are not great. They started us with a complimentary thin slice of cucumber topped with tiny lentils, a tasty tidbit. We then had the lobster bisque which was very good with large chunks of lobster in it. My husband had the bone- in NY strip,medium rare, it was grizzly and very chewy, not worth a price tag of $50. I had the petite Piedmontese filet mignon, 6oz., although extremely small for $50.00 it was very good. We were then given a small scoop of complimentary blood orange sorbet and finished the meal with the pecan pie, good but not memorable. With all the steakhouses in Vegas we have no reason to return here.

Very good food! You have to try the banana cream pie. It is awesome! I had the bone in rib eye and it was delicious even though it was pretty fatty. The price is very high so come prepared to spend some $$$.

Enjoyed the service typically expected for a nice Vegas restaurant.  I ate the rib eye steak cooked medium and was mouth watering.  The portion was big which I had to take home.  The environment is great for a dinner party, but may be loud for a date (we dined on a Wed night).

Fantastic meal and service. I had the filet mignon and my husband had the BBQ salmon. We each ordered a salad (mine the organic greens and his the heirloom tomato and cheese--superb!) and shared the creamed corn. Thank you for the delicious New Years Day meal. We will not forget it and highly recommend coming here for a nice dinner out. .
Excellent steakhouse !!! Food amazing !!! Service 5 star !!! Not much to say just must visit and you'll see ;-)

Five star service the bone in rub eye was a good size and so favor full and tender that I ate the whole thing , the strawberry shortcake was unbelievable . Unlike anything I had before, my wife loved her scallop and macadanina bread pudding. In fact. It was the olmy bread pudding I liked

5 starts (I highly recommend)

Delmonicos earns a five star rating for two reasons.  For one, I've never had a bad experience eating there... Their food and service has always exceeded my expectations.  Secondly, their Pan Seared Foie Gras literally took my breath away because I was enjoying it so much I damn near forgot to breath.  That is saying a lot because normally I don't like liver!  For a quick recommendation, try their filet mignon, duck or ask for their filet medallions, it is off the menu but the flavor is amazing.

For a full review read my post at:
http://foodilistic.com/reviews/delmonicos-las-vegas/
bone in rib eye steak is the popular choice it's corn fed rather than grass fed (piedmontese = italian leaner import).  overall solid with flavor and cooking temp although some were not pleased

First time here and I will be back!

I made reservations a week before on their website and asked for a nice table.

My party of 4 arrived early, but no problem- they had our table ready for us!

We ordered a bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon ($65) and had the following:

I ordered two appetizers for my entree:
1. Vine-Ripened Heirloom Tomato Salad with Burrata Cheese, Red Onion, Extra
Virgin Olive Oil, Balsamic Vinegar and Torn Local Basil.
- I was a little sad that the Burrata cheese was so small compared to the heirloom tomatoes, but it was delicious!

2. Butternut Squash Ravioli with Sage Brown Butter, Toasted Hazelnuts and Parmesan
- OMG!  SO GOOD!  The squash was divine.  I would definitely order this again.

3. Grilled Marinated Organic Chicken Breast - Roasted Fingerling Potatoes, Whole
Garlic, Wild Mushrooms and Natural Reduction
- The person that ate this said that the chicken was cooked perfectly and had really good flavor.

4. Filet Mignon w/ a twice baked potato (with Bacon and Vermont Cheddar) and a Caesar Salad.
- He said that the steak melted in his mouth!

5. Surf & Turf- bone in ribeye and crab & buttered Fresh Asparagus, I believe. (I don't see it on the menu, so it must be a special)
- My husband cleaned his plate.

We also ordered two desserts:
1. Delmonico Chocolate Layer Cake - Chocolate Pudding, Coconut Ice Cream and
Toasted Almonds
- Looked delicious.  They said it was good and the coconut ice cream was amazing!

2. Pecan Pie with Oatmeal Shortbread Crust French, Vanilla Ice Cream & Caramel Sauce
- Pie was in the shape of a circle, so the center was ooey and gooey and yummy!!  Very good!

Price was about $300+ for the table (not including tip).

The service was OUTSTANDING!  We actually had 3 people waiting on us and never had to ask for anything.  They were on-point with re-filling the water at the table!  It was SO nice to never have to look around for someone to help us.  The timing of everything was beautiful.

We even got an amuse-bouche bruschetta when we were deciding what to have for dinner.  What a nice surprise!!

The entire experience was phenomenal!  From the staff, food presentation (loved the table side preparation of our Caesar salad), and of course the flavor of the food. We would absolutely return for another dinner.

Of all steakhouse experiences, this is the best. I have enjoyed many steaks at Delmonico Steak house. Tonight was perfect. 
I enjoyed a New York strip served Piedmontese. My steak was cooked impeccably. Executive Sous Chef Ivan Rojas prepared a meal my wife and I truly appreciated. 
We have been customers here for 5 years now. 
I was raised in the restaurant industry, and I truly appreciate the effort involved to create our meal.

My family went here for Fathers Day at noon. The place had a very nice atmosphere. We sat two minutes after checking in.  Five minutes later, a waiter approached us and took our order for drinks. He introduced himself and another waitress. We got our drinks and ten to fifteen minutes later, a different waitress gave us bread.  A person in a suit then approached us to ask if we were ready to order. We replied, "Yes".  He then walked away instead of taking our order. I would assume that he is the manager.  A different waitress then approached us to Finally take our order.  This took more than half an hour from the time we sat down.  Sad thing was that the table behind us sat after we did and was already eating their appetizer before someone took our order.  Mind you, we sat before several customers and they were attended to first. Very very poor start of customer service.  I would think that this place would have excellent service consistently.  Another, I had black slacks on. I placed the napkin on my lap, and behold the napkin left tons of white lint on my black pants.  I went to other restaurants in Vegas and I was offered a black napkin to use instead.  Others, the napkin did not leave as much lint as this one did. I ordered the lobster bisque, which was excellent. Creamy, smooth, and a lot of flavor.  I also ordered the filet medallions.  It had panko breading which I really didn't care for.  The bacon was charred and hard, but the two filet medallions were great.  It also had a simple sauce with small mushrooms. My dad had the lobster sliders.  The sliders were surprisingly great according to my dad.  They didn't skimp on the lobster.  Instead of shredded pieces, they are a generous portion in the sliders.  The bread they offered got cold pretty quick but it was still good to eat.  At first, drinks were coming in slow. Then the waiters paid more attention to us in the end.  The restroom was located all the way in the very back.  I thought I had to exit the building itself to use the restroom.  You have to through a very long hallway to the very back towards the exit sign.  The sink was shallow and I could barely wash my hands in it since it's so shallow that my hands will get wet from the dirty water in the sink.  There was only one sink available.  Food would have been excellent.  Service was mediocre.  I'm not sure I would return here if I have this kind of service.  It was my first time here.

Delicious steak house! I will recommend you make reservations and come with a healthy appetite! This place is top notch. The decor is romantic and comfortable. I would definitely tell you truffle lovers to order the truffled potato chips. I promise they won't disappoint. In regards to the meat, it's comparable to any wonderful steakhouse I've ever been to. The service was phenomenal. This is a place I will definitely be returning to, it's a gem on the strip !
Great ribeye steak.  Cooked perfectly.  Was a little disappointed in the "sides".  Overall good experience but would probably choose Bouchon 1st.

We had a great experience at Delmonico.  Great food, wine and service made for a great meal.

We started with bbq shrimp and ahi tartare.  The bbq shrimp is New Orleans style which is shrimp in gravy rather than a typical bbq and it was very tasty.

The gumbo was good and had a bit of heat, great stuff.

My bone-in ribeye was cooked to medium and had a creole rub that was delicious.

My son had a huge, huge cheeseburger that was very tasty.  

The service was prompt, attentive and courteous.

I grew up in Texas, so I know a good steak when I see it.  The bone in ribeye served here is fantastic.

Expect to spend at least $100/person when dining here, you don't get a great meal here on the cheap...

Overall, this is a good option for a high-end steakhouse.

I order the filet mignon medallions and they were incredible. 

The turn-off for me was the service.  Super slow service and I felt that we were at times treated like second-class citizens.

Oh well!
I had dinner here couple weeks ago with all my team members from work, party of 7. Everything that we ordered was great and it's like you can't go wrong with all the dishes.

I have to say that my steak which was the ribeye on bone was tasty.My friends steak being the kobe steak, was dry. Not what i expected for a Kobe steak. But considering that mines was good, I give it 4 stars. Kobe steak 3.

Came here with my family on a Saturday evening over a holiday and got seated right away. The atmosphere itself was nice and the restaurant wasn't very busy, but one of the first things I noticed was that it usually took a lot more effort than I would expect at a nice restaurant that wasn't crowded to begin with to get our server's attention. The servers themselves were great and always helpful but just seemed to be pretty absent most of the night.

The food itself was very good. The pre-dinner rolls were light, which I liked so you didn't get too full on bread before your actual meal came. I ordered the BBQ Salmon. A lot of other plates at our table were the rib-eyes. Everything was cooked perfectly, and my only complaint might be that the salmon was really heavy on BBQ sauce. Portions were large enough to be worth the price, but it really depended on the items ordered.

Overall 5 for food, 3 for service.

This was a great venue to have some dinner and enjoy the company of friends.  Located in restaurant row in the Venetian, this place is an Emeril restaurant that features steaks and sides of high quality.  

A few of my party actually shared the rib eye because it was a really bit cut of meat.  That combined with the great sides made a wonderful meal.  Service was impeccable as our waiter and other staff were engaged and always on top of what we needed.

For sides, I'd suggest the grits and bacon.  I ate the whole side dish and barely shared with others.  The creamed corn was surprisingly good and the brussels were also really good.  For dessert, we had the strawberry shortcake which came in a jar which was terribly good.  We also had the chocolate cake and key lime pie.  I didn't try too much of that as I was stuck digging my spoon in the strawberry shortcake. 

For a great balance of food and service, I highly recommend.

Everything was good but not great except the steak!

We ordered the Chateaubriand, which was very tender, juicy and lean.  Quality was so closed to Wagyu.  I really had that Emeril's BAM feeling after the first bite.

Lobster Bisque and Gumbo tasted above average.

Creme Brulee was average.

On the side note, this restaurant was unusually noisy, don't know why.
Outstanding!! Service - Perfect!! Food - Excellent and large portion size!  Clean & Elegant.

I'm so sad that my boyfriend and I were foolish enough to eat a huge lunch leaving us unprepared for the awesomeness of this place. We were staying in The Venetian with a group of friends and decided on a good steak dinner. As mentioned, my boyfriend and I were still stuffed from lunch so we went for the Cesar salad for two and each got a potato on the side. The salad was so fresh and delicious, and made right at the table. The potatoes were almost too big but delightful. Everyone at the table had what looked to be an amazing steak, the one bite I stole was heaven.

Wow, I can't believe this place getting 4 stars. BAM to POOF to me.
First off the bread ... if you do not know now to make a simple bread ... how hard it is ... even my homemade bread taste better than that hard piece of rock they served. 
Maybe it was just a bad day for me. But it cannot be that bad right. nooo ... but sorry to say ... it is a yes for me.
Waiter ... service ... zero! rude and didn't ask if we are done and took everything away ... but the food was bad anyways take it away as fast as you can.
Jumbo shrimp and petite fiilet mignon ... non fresh shrimp made for bad combo plus ... I ordered medium rare and it came out well done. hmm ... either the waiter doesn't know how to write his order or the head chef or whoever is cooking is just as bad as emeril lagasse himself. 
Then to coffee ... argh ... disgusting ... and we were like complaining and the waiter came by and asked ... we can brew a fresh one for you??? ... i was like WTF ... this was not a fresh brew to began with ... argh disgusting and chills all over my body ... so time to get out pronto!!!

The only good thing that came out of this is the wine we ordered ... they have an extensive selection and kudos for that ... 

But I am never going back ... $55 for the entree ... I rather go to McD and I know what I am getting for $5.50.

Thank you Dad who said that my cooking with a costco steak is better than whatever they whipped up at demonic ... haa haa.
The best steak I've had so far.. Very good service and the bread was delicious!

Great meal, would be excellent but I had to send my steak back for a little more cooking (I said medium to well and it was more on the medium side - I am a bit picky with that).

The service was perfect, however. Didn't have to wait long for anything, and I really like that the whole table is served at the same time, it's a nice subtle touch. Very attentive and friendly service.

I enjoyed the experience and was not disappointed even going in with a high expectation.

Everything about this place was amazing.  The food, the service, the ambiance, it couldn't have been better.  We began our meal with bbq shrimp, bone-in bacon, and lobster bisque, all of which were delicious.  Now on to the steaks. We ordered bone-in ribeyes and this was by far the best steak I've ever had. It was perfectly prepared and the flavor was out of this world. For our sides we ordered sautéed mushrooms and grits, both of which were equally delicious.  We finished our meal with dessert and we ended up with two, the pecan pie and the caramel butter cake, both of which were, you guessed it, delicious!

Let's talk about the staff and the service.  From the host that greeted us when we walked in, to the gentleman that walked us to our seats, to the three gentlemen that served us, everything and everyone was absolutely delightful.  The three gentlemen serving us were Rene, Brian, and David, and they ran like a well oiled machine.  They were very attentive and very pleasant people, and they helped make our dining experience so wonderful. 

The ambiance was perfect for our early xmas dinner.  We had a table where we were able to comfortably eat dinner, have a conversation without screaming at each other, and we weren't wedged between other people being forced to share our dining experience with strangers. 

Definitely a five star establishment with five star food and five star service. We will definitely be back.

This place is where  you want to go. The food  is excellent.  I got the dry aged , wet aged bone in ribeye steak. It melts  in your mouth its so tender. The reason I say this is the place  you want to go is because  the service is as good as the meal.\nYour not stretching your neck  looking  for your server.  Water glasses were always  full and our steaks all landed  at the same time  by 3 servers.\nThey have a seamless flow to the meal. If you haven't  been here please treat yourself

Delmonico's is a great place to dine while staying in Vegas (especially if you are staying at the Venetian).  

Service:
The distinguishing characteristic here is the service.  We had 10:00pm reservation on Valentine's day and were flying in to Vegas to meet friends for a weekend getaway (got that? good).  Our flight out of SFO was delayed and we ended up arriving at the restaraunt at 10:48, long after we should have been seated etc.  Our waitress was the essence of efficiency; without missing a beat she let us know that last orders were due at 11:00.  They key here was she always made us feel like she was on "our team" rather than making us feel as if our lateness at created an inconvienience for her.  She helped all six of us get seated and get our orders in "before the bell" (as it were).  She got a $100+ tip for being a pro.

Food:
This is a steakhouse, order a steak.  Mine was flavorful without being fatty or gristly, pink without being bloody and just the right amount charred on the outside.  This was the ribeye steak, but the bone-in ribeye ordered by one of my partners in crime was equally well-prepared and duly appreciated.  My wife thought her crab-stuffed halibut (wrapped in a potato skin) was good (but not great?).  

Cost:
You won't find an entree for under $50 and the sides are extra (we had a group of 6 so that actually worked out wonderfully and we ended up dining quasi-family-style).  The asparagus and mushrooms were hits!  With tip (21%), the bill came to exactly $100/person.  I think we all had at least one drink and the girls split a bottle of wine, one desert and a few coffees were ordered.

Bottom Line:
The service here was friendly and professional.  The staff make you feel welcome and are eager to please.  The food is extremely good and a decent value (it is Vegas after all).  Go here if you like steak and are willing to pay a little extra.

A 5  rating for a 5 restaurant. Located in between the beautiful Palazzo and Venetian Hotel, this restaurant and their staff truly were amazing. From the moment we walked in, every staff member was attentive to our needs. They truly took care of us (party of 7), the waiter was amazing and truly enjoys his job. The food was amazing! Everyone enjoyed their meals and salads/soups. We had a slight small incident with my mom who slipped as we were walking in, and every couple of minutes the manager in charge, Tyler, came and checked on my mom several times. Despite the fall, the restaurant is amazing, we were happy we choose DelMonicos for our dinner!! Keep up the great job!
Excellent service! Our waiter Frank was wonderful! We typically eat at Mastro's...boy 'am I glad we came here! My halibut entree was excellent! The sides were delicious! Highly recommend!
Bone in ribeye was incredible. Even offered a special "book" of scotch selections.

Food was excellent and drinks were okay. We had the ribeye (boneless) and ahi tuna and salmon with the BBQ shrimp appetizer. Added cream of corn (excellent!) and spinach (bland) and had a great dinner. Staff was accommodating and pleasant but a bit formal for our taste. We had a short wait on the front end of our visit but all in all very good.

So, I've always thought Emeril was a lot of talk and no action, but I was wrong to judge without experiencing Emeril's cooking. 

On our first night in Vegas, we made last-minute reservations for 9:30.   The restaurant is in kind of a weird place.  It's literally in the corner of the basement.  Granted, there are restaurants next to it, it still felt like it was at the edge of the earth.   Inside is relaxed.  It's dimly lit and the ceilings are low (again, more basement feel), but overall, it's very nice.

We were starved, so we went right to the entrees, but they were delicious.  My boyfriend, the meat-eater in the group, had the filet, which he claims is the best cut of filet he has ever had.  He says it was cooked to perfection and it was absolutely perfect.  And, he's had quite a few steaks.  I had bacon-wrapped sea bass with pesto, roasted tomatoes, and some potato goodness, that I can't remember.  I mean, in all honesty, I wasn't expecting to be impressed, so I didn't pay much attention to the intricacies of the dish.  But, it was amazing.  The fish was cooked perfectly, the flavors were a perfect compliment to each other.  It was perfect.  

And, for dessert, we shared the banana cream pie, which I knew was legendary, and quite frankly, it was the only thing that disappointed me.  It was good, but I think I expected more.  Regardless...this was a great meal, and well worth every penny.

5 stars for food, minus one for weird location and ambiance.

Another large group dinner with the co-workers, this time we selected Delmonico Steakhouse.  Wow, I am impressed.  This is what I call classy.  I didn't even realize this was an Emeril Lagasse restaurant until I examined the doggie bag afterward!

The food is top notch, I ordered the butternut squash ravioli (sans duck confit) and the wild arugula w/ raspberries.  Both dishes were just the right size (not too big, not too small), beautifully presented, perfectly seasoned and dressed, and absolutely delicious.

We ordered and shared the green apple crisp a la mode for dessert, I might have loved it more if I was still hungry, but I was so stuffed that I couldn't properly enjoy it.  Note to self: next time, dessert first!

Literally, there was not a single bite leftover from anyone's plate.

In regards to the service, our server Jen was such a sweetheart, she seemed like a friend right from the start.  Not too intrusive, but relaxed and attentive.  Very accommodating and down to earth.

Must try items: Homemade potato chips with parmesan, truffle oil and scallions.  I was stuffing my face like no tomorrow and scraping the plate clean...The warm dinner rolls w/ butter...They smelled SO buttery!  Lastly, the corn gratin, the panko topping was so crispy, it was unreal, the gratin underneath was hot, steamy, and sweet from the crisp fresh corn.  SOOO GOOOD!

All in all, this place was expensive, but none of the staff had to overdo it to impress us, the atmosphere, food and service spoke for itself, so it was worth every penny.

LOVE

I go to this restaurant every time I go to Vegas, which in my line of work is about 4 times a year. The food and service can't be beat. Now, in a fairness it is one of those she she places where everything is rediculously over priced and gives you that feeling of "do i make enough money to eat here" lol Its all an act and at the end of the day, it really is a fantastic place to eat!

Hands down, the best meal I've ever had.

My boyfriend and I were 20minutes late to our reservation, but they stil accommodated us within 2minutes after getting there. We had THREE servers: one for wine, one for food, and one for.. I don't even know, just to make us feel like royalty!

We ordered the bone-in rib-eye and the filet mignon. Although the bone-in rib-eye is the most popular steak at the restaurant, my personal favorite is the filet mignon just for its AMAZING tenderness. I'm really bad at describing taste with words, so all I will say is this: perfection. And you HAVE to pair the steaks with the house red wine. It transformed our meal even more.

And for dessert, we got the banana cream pie.. and I wanted to cry. That honestly the best way for me to describe my experience. I took one bite, and wanted to cry. "It was the best tasting dessert I had ever had in my life" is an understatement.

Finally, I loved the look of the restaurant. It wasn't as dimly lit was I thought it would be, which I actually was pleasantly surprised about because I'm tired of not being able to see my food. The design is very minimalist but still very sophisticated.. but not TOO sophisticated that regular folks like my boyfriend and I didn't feel out of place.

Although it was incredibly expensive, the food and the overall experience was so incredible that even my boyfriend, who can be pretty frugal sometimes, said that Delmonico's HAS to be a place we go back to EVERY year. I can't wait for the next time. :)
This place is perfect. Love eating here. Its my top pick for steak in Vegas. I try to go every time I'm in town. Love the bone in ribeye. Lots of good drinks to. Its a must.

More like 2.5 stars.

Came in for a late Friday night dinner. Started with martinis - awesome.

My wife and I both ordered filets cooked medium. The steaks came out super fast and were unfortunately super rare. My wife decided to eat hers, but I sent mine back. My steak came back closer to medium rare than medium, and the flavor was gone. I waited at least ten minutes for the steak to come back, and it was a miss. On top of that, my filet's cut was poor. The sides were fine - mushrooms and twice baked potato.

I kind of felt that the kitchen and management really blew this for us. At a place with a price point like this, walking in just before closing shouldn't impact the food quality. I feel like the kitchen wanted the steak out ASAP so they could shut down for he night. On top of that, no manager came to say a word about the mistake, and nothing was done to compensate for it - no comped drink or dessert or even a "sorry" from the management. I think that this is inexcusable considering this is an Emeril restaurant and is quite pricey.

Not sure we will return, which is too bad because we are fond of the place from past visits.

Before I went to this place, I checked some reviews which were mostly positive. First, staff was very courteous and decor was simple and inviting. One thing I noticed was there were way too many employees waking and standing around and it was very distracting at times. As for the food, other than the Bone in Ribeye steak which was decent considering the portion and the price, everything else was a real disappointment. I got better lobster bisque at Lobster ME next door for $4, I mean A Lot BETTER. Their soup was awful.\nI really wanted to like this place considering it was our wedding anniversary but it was a real letdown.

Simply delicious. I had the pork chop and my coworkers dived into the steak. Everything was so tasty, cooked to perfection. Definitely one of the better steakhouses I've dined in. Will definitely be back for more

I did the 2012 Restaurant Week $30.12 lunch special here which was a pretty good deal for a 3-course meal at an Emeril Lagasse restaurant inside the Venetian.  

Five stars for participating in Restaurant Week and donating a portion of proceeds to Vegas' Three Square charity, having excellent food, friendly and professional service.

Slight demerit for having nice but very plan decor (ceilings/walls pretty much barren), but I care more about food than the eatery/setting anyways.

I'll start out by saying the service and environment were both great.  Delmonico seems to draw a good balance between those hyper-formal restaurants where utensil etiquette matters and more casual fine dining restaurants. 

I tried the foie gras and octopus appetizers.  The octopus was delicious and had a decent amount of meat.  The foie gras was rich.  I followed these with the gumbo which had a mild spiciness that anyone should be able to enjoy.

The disappointment occurred during the main course.  Three of the people in our party ordered the filet mignon.  Two of us were immediately dissatisfied with the plate.  I had ordered medium-rare and my dissatisfied friend had ordered theirs rare. My filet was noticeably dry and neither were especially tender. I suspect mine may have been overcooked because the third filet was also a medium-rare and the butter on top of their steak was still present, whereas mine had altogether melted by the time the plate reached our table.    Additionally, whatever seasoning was used for my filet was not spread evenly.  There was only one bite where the seasoning became obvious and it overwhelmed the flavor of the meat.

For a steak that costs over $50 at an establishment that is a steakhouse, I hold it to certain standards, like being appreciated by a majority of the people at my party who ordered it. I can understand one person not enjoying their steak at a table because they have specific preferences, but for two people at the same table to be dissatisfied makes me believe the quality of the cooking is unreliable.  I have definitely cooked better steaks than the ones I tried  during this meal, and unfortunately this is the first steakhouse I have been to where that has been the case.

I took my wife and daughter here during spring break. Whow. We each ordered a different kind of steak. Each came out exactly as ordered and at exactly the same time! The steaks were a lot bigger than expected and we had to ask for doggie boxes. (We finished it off the next day!) Great wine selection. Great service.\n\nMy only complaint is the table are too close together and if the people next to you do not bump you, the waiter does as he passes between tables. That was a real pain. They need to rearrange the seating. Ask for a corner table to avoid this problem. If they fix that, I would give them five stars.

We went on Christmas Day, so had a few specials. Started with they oysters - very good. Then a duck salad. The duck was rich but was cooked right. It's extremely hard to cook good duck, but they nailed it! Then I got the filet minion, medium rare. It melted in my mouth. It was amazing. It may have been more on the rare side, but I had no complaints. To finish off my experience I got the bread pudding. Just like the filet, amazing. The pecan buttered ice cream and the warm bread was bigger than it looked - but had no problem finishing it. In our group of 3, we each got a different menu item - I feel like what i got trumped the other dishes. Try it!

While on an extended stay at the Palazzo we decided to try Delmonico. I made a reservation through Open Table. We were seated promptly but at a table that was less than desirable where the waiter had to stand behind me while serving us. He was quite pushy and brusque. My wife ordered the half duck as she loves duck. Right after we were served the waiter returned and asked if everything was OK, My wife had taken one bite from the duck leg and she said that things were OK. But as she continued to work on the rest of the duck it seemed to become very tough like it had been over microwaived. She signaled the waiter over and rather than handling it professionally he asked in a rather accusing manner why she had said the duck was OK when first asked. This made us feel very uncomfortable. The waiter did remove the duck and did not charge us for it. However, we just wanted some excellent food. I'll never return to any of Emeril's restaurants based on this encounter. If you want a good meal while at the Venetian / Palazzo go to Bouchon where you'll be treated well and the food is great. Just to be balanced I will say that the rib eye that I had was good.

My 4th time going to the restaurant and it didn't disappoint. Made reservations for 9pm but I forgot where it was. Made the mad scramble for 2 blocks. When I called the woman who answered said no problem. The bartender was exceptional, stearing me towards a good whiskey. Of course the steak itself. To describe the steak would only cheapen the experience. Very worth the money.

Top notch steaks and one of the best wine lists in Las Vegas. Perfectly seasoned and prepared steaks in the main dining room makes for a great night out, but what makes The Delmonico Steakhouse a DESTINATION is their individually planned and prepared tasting menu, available during an evening at their special Kitchen Table. 

They have a glass room with space for 8, connected to the kitchen where you'll enjoy a special tasting menu prepared by the Chef on duty. And when I say special menu, I mean just that. Chefs are passionate about menu planning and specialty food and they'll give you a 6-8 course meal featuring the steak of course, and many other things not available on their menu, finished with a dessert tray to die for, featured every one of the desserts they offer. 

This is an Emeril restaurant but you won't see any made for TV dinners here - it's truly an authentic steakhouse with an upscale dining room. For the wine lover, Master sommelier Kevin Vogt will work with the chef to perfectly pair wine with each course. What is special, as of my last visit, is The Delmonico Steakhouse runs independent of the other food services at The Venitian. This means they shop for their own food and manage their own wine collection. So if you enjoy fine wine, perfectly paired with your meal - this is the place for you. 

This is my #1 all time favorite restaurant. The food is good enough to stand on its own, and because of the special treatment you get at the kitchen table, I've yet to experience anything so great.

How much? You'll be shocked and surprised to learn this dining experience isn't terribly expensive. For a little more than you'd spend in the dining room, you get a personal dining experience, about $85 for dinner and wine pairing for about $65.

I call this a once in a lifetime experience, even though I've been lucky enough to do it about ten times.

Never get between a girl and her BONE-IN RIBEYE....NEVER!

When deciding on restaurant for my friend's BIG 3-OH B-Day dinner, it was between CUT, N9NE, and Delmonico's. After YELPING and looking over all the menus, Delmonico's was the winner because it was conveniently located in The Venetian (we were staying at the Palazzo), decently priced compared to CUT, and had rave reviews about the bone-in ribeye. 

RESERVATIONS: 
Making reservations was quick and simple. You can make reservations directly through the restaurant as opposed to The Wynn Restaurants where you have to call their restaurant hotline number and the wait is 20+ minutes.

On Friday, March 4, 2010, our party of 9 arrived around 7:15 PM. As we were escorted to our table, we couldn't help but notice the shape of our table. A round table was connected to a rectangular table which errr, resembled a male part. Don't know if it was intentional since I told them it was my male's friend's b-day party? Anyhow, it made for a good laugh. 

FOOD:
*Lobster Bisque ($12.50): Rich, velvety smooth with generous chunks of sweet tender lobster equals YUMMYNESS! The only complaint is it was a bit too salty for my taste. Four of my friends also had the bisque and complained about the same thing.

*16 oz Bone-in Ribeye ($52): One word...WOW! The bone-in ribeye, aged for 8 weeks was one the most flavorful steaks I've ever tasted! The ribeye was cooked to a perfect medium rare with nice charred crust and a pink center. You can tell that the marbling slowly melted and basted the meat during the cooking process producing a rich, amazingly tender, and savory cut of meat. Aside from the Kobe from Craftsteak, this is hands-down the best steak ever; and for the price point, you really can't go wrong. If there weren't anyone watching, I would have literally grabbed the ribeye by the bone and gone to town cave-man style--it was THAT good!
